body:
The image version of a deployment doesn't change after I up/downgrade to a newer/older chart version with a different appVersion.

e.g.:
Output of `helm ls`:
```
NAME    NAMESPACE       REVISION        UPDATED                                 STATUS          CHART
mongo   mongo           1               2019-09-05 15:52:16.95821 +0200 CEST    deployed        mongodb-7.2.7
```
```
helm upgrade  mongo stable/mongodb --version 6.2.0
```
`helm ls`
```
NAME    NAMESPACE       REVISION        UPDATED                                 STATUS          CHART        
mongo   mongo           2               2019-09-05 15:54:14.122248 +0200 CEST   deployed        mongodb-6.2.0
```
After I downgraded mongodb from chart version 7.2.7 to 6.2.0 the chart version changed but the deployment still used the old image version. (4.0.12 instead of 4.0.10)

Output of `kubectl get deployments mongo-mongodb -o yaml | grep image`: 
```
        image: docker.io/bitnami/mongodb:4.0.12-debian-9-r22
```
Output of `kubectl get deployments mongo-mongodb -o yaml | grep chart` on same deployment:
```
    chart: mongodb-6.2.0
        chart: mongodb-6.2.0
```
Same issue appeared with different charts like grafana.

Output of `helm version`:
```
version.BuildInfo{Version:"v3.0.0-beta.2", GitCommit:"26c7338408f8db593f93cd7c963ad56f67f662d4", GitTreeState:"clean", GoVersion:"go1.12.9"}
```
Output of `kubectl version`:
```
Client Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"15", GitVersion:"v1.15.3", GitCommit:"2d3c76f9091b6bec110a5e63777c332469e0cba2", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2019-08-19T12:36:28Z", GoVersion:"go1.12.9", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"darwin/amd64"}
Server Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"15", GitVersion:"v1.15.3", GitCommit:"2d3c76f9091b6bec110a5e63777c332469e0cba2", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2019-08-19T11:05:50Z", GoVersion:"go1.12.9", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"}
```
Cloud Provider/Platform (AKS, GKE, Minikube etc.): 
`AKS`
